From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Aragonese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin initiāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /iniˈθja(ɾ)/
  • IPA(key): /iniˈsja(ɾ)/ (Benasquese)
  • Syllabification: i‧ni‧ciar
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

iniciar

  1. (transitive) to start, begin
    Synonyms: escomenzar, comenzar, principiar, prencipiar, emprincipiar, emprencipiar
  2. (transitive) to initiate

Related terms

[edit]
  • iniciación
  • inicial
  • inicio

Further reading

[edit]
  • Diccionario ortografico de l'aragonés (Seguntes la PO de l'EFA)

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin initiāre. Cf. also començar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [i.ni.siˈa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [i.ni.siˈaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Hyphenation: i‧ni‧ci‧ar

Verb

[edit]

iniciar (first-person singular present inicio, first-person singular preterite inicií, past participle iniciat)

  1. (transitive) to start, begin
    Synonym: començar
  2. (transitive) to initiate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of iniciar (first conjugation)
infinitive iniciar
gerund iniciant
past participle masculine feminine
singular iniciat iniciada
plural iniciats iniciades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present inicio inicies inicia iniciem inicieu inicien
imperfect iniciava iniciaves iniciava iniciàvem iniciàveu iniciaven
future iniciaré iniciaràs iniciarà iniciarem iniciareu iniciaran
preterite inicií iniciares inicià iniciàrem iniciàreu iniciaren
conditional iniciaria iniciaries iniciaria iniciaríem iniciaríeu iniciarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present iniciï iniciïs iniciï iniciem inicieu iniciïn
imperfect iniciés iniciessis iniciés iniciéssim iniciéssiu iniciessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — inicia iniciï iniciem inicieu iniciïn
negative (no) — no iniciïs no iniciï no iniciem no inicieu no iniciïn

Related terms

[edit]
  • inici
  • iniciació
  • iniciador
  • inicial
  • iniciat

Further reading

[edit]
  • “iniciar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.
  • “iniciar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “iniciar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “iniciar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Latin

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • (Classical Latin) IPA(key): [ɪˈnɪ.ki.ar]
  • (modern Italianate Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): [iˈniː.t͡ʃi.ar]

Verb

[edit]

iniciar

  1. first-person singular future passive indicative of iniciō

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin initiāre. Cf. also começar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /i.ni.siˈa(ʁ)/ [i.ni.sɪˈa(h)], (faster pronunciation) /i.niˈsja(ʁ)/ [i.niˈsja(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /i.ni.siˈa(ʁ)/ [i.ni.sɪˈa(h)], (faster pronunciation) /i.niˈsja(ʁ)/ [i.niˈsja(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /i.ni.siˈa(ɾ)/ [i.ni.sɪˈa(ɾ)], (faster pronunciation) /i.niˈsja(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /i.ni.siˈa(ʁ)/ [i.ni.sɪˈa(χ)], (faster pronunciation) /i.niˈsja(ʁ)/ [i.niˈsja(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /i.ni.siˈa(ɻ)/ [i.ni.sɪˈa(ɻ)], (faster pronunciation) /i.niˈsja(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.niˈsjaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.niˈsjaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /i.niˈsja.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: i‧ni‧ci‧ar

Verb

[edit]

iniciar (first-person singular present inicio, first-person singular preterite iniciei, past participle iniciado)

  1. (transitive) to start, begin, initiate
    Synonym: começar

Conjugation

[edit]

2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • iniciação

Further reading

[edit]
  • “iniciar”, in Dicionário Aulete Digital (in Portuguese), Rio de Janeiro: Lexikon Editora Digital, 2008–2025
  • “iniciar”, in Dicionário inFormal (in Portuguese), 2006–2025
  • “iniciar” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913
  • “iniciar”, in Dicionário infopédia da Lingua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Porto: Porto Editora, 2003–2025
  • “iniciar”, in Michaelis Dicionário Brasileiro da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), São Paulo: Editora Melhoramentos, 2015–2025
  • “iniciar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin initiāre. Cf. also comenzar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /iniˈθjaɾ/ [i.niˈθjaɾ] (Spain)
  • IPA(key): /iniˈsjaɾ/ [i.niˈsjaɾ] (Latin America, Philippines)
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: i‧ni‧ciar

Verb

[edit]

iniciar (first-person singular present inicio, first-person singular preterite inicié, past participle iniciado)

  1. (transitive) to begin; to initiate
    Synonym: comenzar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of iniciar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive iniciar
gerund iniciando
past participle masculine feminine
singular iniciado iniciada
plural iniciados iniciadas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes

iniciásvos 		inicia iniciamos iniciáis inician
imperfect iniciaba iniciabas iniciaba iniciábamos iniciabais iniciaban
preterite inicié iniciaste inició iniciamos iniciasteis iniciaron
future iniciaré iniciarás iniciará iniciaremos iniciaréis iniciarán
conditional iniciaría iniciarías iniciaría iniciaríamos iniciaríais iniciarían

vos 		él/ella/ello

imperfect
(se) 		iniciase iniciases iniciase iniciásemos iniciaseis iniciasen
future1 iniciare iniciares iniciare iniciáremos iniciareis iniciaren

vos 		usted nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros

affirmative iniciatú
iniciávos 		inicie iniciemos iniciad inicien
negative no inicies no inicie no iniciemos no iniciéis no inicien

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

    Selected combined forms of iniciar

These forms are generated automatically and may not actually be used. Pronoun usage varies by region.

accusative not used iniciémoste iniciémoslo, iniciémosla iniciémonos iniciémoos iniciémoslos, iniciémoslas
with informal second-person plural imperative iniciad dative iniciadme not used iniciadle iniciadnos iniciaos iniciadles
accusative iniciadme not used iniciadlo, iniciadla iniciadnos iniciaos iniciadlos, iniciadlas
with formal second-person plural imperative inicien dative inícienme not used inícienle iníciennos not used inícienles, iníciense
accusative inícienme not used inícienlo, inícienla iníciennos not used inícienlos, inícienlas, iníciense

  • iniciado

  • iniciar sesión
